page.title: 16SURVEY OF RADIO AND T.V.
page.content: Sample of 119 local people,48 male,71 female.Five age groups selected:a.0-12 (22 interviews);b.13-17(25);c.18-29(24) d.30-59(27);e.60+(21).Analysis of class stucture showed 32 class 1\2;58 class 3;28 class 4\5. In the households covered all had at least one TV set.96.2% had at least one colour TV.72.4% had more than one TV set.28.6% of homes had a teletext TV set.44.5% of homes have a video,and of those homes 66.0% have VHS,28.3% Beta and 5.7% Phillips 2000 format.Only 19.0% of the 60+age group have access to Teletext,and 14.3% to video.Most of these live where there are childeren Average time spent watching TV each week was 28.2 hours.As expected,people in the 60+ group watch most,averaging 33.0 hours.People in the under 18 group averaged 28.0 hours.
